Can you provide me with more information on the Aberdare Canal Trail? How long is it and where does it start and end? Also, are there any notable landmarks or attractions along the way?

The Aberdare Canal Trail is a 16-mile (25 km) walking and cycling route that follows the old route of the Aberdare Canal from Aberdare to Merthyr Tydfil. The trail is largely traffic-free and offers some great views of the surrounding countryside.

The trail starts at Aberdare Railway Station and follows the canal route northwards towards Abernant, eventually reaching the village of Hirwaun. From there, it continues along the canal before turning south towards Troedyrhiw, where it links up with the Taff Trail. The trail then follows the Taff Trail eastwards, passing through the town of Merthyr Tydfil before ending at Cardiff Bay.

Along the way, there are several notable landmarks and attractions to see, such as the Cyfarthfa Castle Museum & Art Gallery in Merthyr Tydfil, the ruins of Aberdare Ironworks, and the Brecon Mountain Railway in Pant. There are also several picturesque villages and towns to explore, such as Cefn-coed-y-cymmer and Troedyrhiw.

The Aberdare Canal Trail is a great way to explore the history and natural beauty of the area, and it's suitable for walkers and cyclists of all abilities.
